dxf2svg.svg
Class SvgText

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.svg.SvgElement
      dxf2svg.svg.SvgObject
          dxf2svg.svg.SvgText
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SvgAttrib, SvgMultiLineText
public class SvgText
extends SvgObject

This class encapsulates a single line of text in SVG. All fonts used in the conversion should be TrueType® fonts. Any other unknown fonts (not a truetype font) will be substituted with Courier. You may also specify a URL to a specific font. This URL need not be on this system but TableStyles.setPrimaryFontFileName(java.lang.String) does test for valid TrueType fonts and includes the URL in the @font-face Cascading Style Sheet.

Note: SvgText elements and its descendants, can mutate into <desc> elements if their anchor (insertion) point is outside of the limits rectangle (see LimitsFrame for more information).

Version:
1.01 - December 7, 2004
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Constant Field Values

fontScaleFactor

public static final double fontScaleFactor
This is the magic number that AutoCAD uses for text leading. It is used as the basis for all calculations of distances between lines. Any deviation of this value is handled by a line leading scale factor that ranges from 0.25 - 4.00. The trouble is, AutoCAD uses strictly ascenders to measure height and any other text handling application includes the leading as part of the true height. So multiply this number by the AutoCAD reported font measure size to get the adjusted scale.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Method Detail

createSecondAlignmentPoint

protected void createSecondAlignmentPoint(double x,
                                          double y)
This method allows the EntityProcessor to create a second alignment point which will occur if the group codes 72 horizontal justification values, and 73 vertical justification values, are populated.

Parameters:
x - value of point
y - value of point

setHorizontalJustification

public void setHorizontalJustification(int hjust)
Sets the horizontal justification; options being left,center and right. There is a complicated relationship between this method and {link: #setVerticalJustify}. If group code 73, which dictates vertical justification, is set to '0' or missing then this value takes on the role of describing, in a more general fashion, whether the text is left, center, right, aligned, middle or fit.

Parameters:
hjust - horizontal justification value.

setVerticalJustification

public void setVerticalJustification(int vjust)
Sets the vertical justification; options being baseline,bottom middle and top. There is a complicated relationship between this method and {link: #setHorizontalJustify}. If group code 72, which dictates horizontal justification.

Parameters:
vjust - integer horizontal justification value.

setObliqueAngle

public void setObliqueAngle(double angle)
This method sets the skew of the text and is not related to italic.

getString

public java.lang.String getString()

find

public boolean find(java.util.regex.Pattern p)
This method allows for the searching of the content of a SvgText element and through inheritance an SvgMultilineText element.

The argument pattern is tested against the unformatted content of this object. Unformatted means before any characters are replaced with any character entities.

Also note that this method finds only the first instance of the pattern in the content string. Use the getString() method to capture the content and do further comparisons if required.

Returns:
true if the pattern matched this SvgText object's content, false otherwise.

setRotation

public void setRotation(double rotation)
This method sets the rotation angle of the text.

Parameters:
rotation - of text

setWidthFactor

public void setWidthFactor(double width)
This method sets the width scaling factor of text. It uses the width factor value directly from the Dxf file.

Parameters:
width - the width factor of the text

setApplingRules

protected void setApplingRules()
Calculates styling rules for an SvgText. Styling rules are a series of bits that encode what sort of styling an object takes. In the case of SvgText if the any values have been set on an entity explicitly it generally means that this is a special case which contradicts the styling rules set up in the TableStyles for this text's style. 1 = Fill
2 = Colour
4 = Text Height
8 = Font Family
All other attributes are included in the text's attributes. Attributes like oblique angle and width factor do not seem to work through cascading style sheets so they must remain in-line.

Sets the fill of the text object.

getJustify

protected void getJustify()
Calculates and returns a string discribing the justification of text within an MTEXT object which is has the same result as having set the 'attachment point' in on an MTEXT box.

getTransformationIfNecessary

protected void getTransformationIfNecessary(java.lang.StringBuffer attribString)
This method calculates the necessary transformation data for a string. Typically text needs transformation if the text generation flag indicates that the text should be backwards and or upside down. Text is also transformed if width factor and or oblique angle are required.

Parameters:
attribString - string.

calculatePointXSkew

protected void calculatePointXSkew(Point point)
This method calculates the compensating anchor position of skewed text.

Parameters:
point - the insertion point of text to be skewed.

setY

public void setY(double y)
Sets the Anchor's y value.

Overrides:
setY in class SvgObject

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Writes the text element to an Svg element. If the text string's anchor is outside of limits rectangle of the DXF file this method will publish its content into <desc> tags for inclusion as meta-data in the Svg file. If the text is output as meta-data, special characters are not converted to their character entities.

Overrides:
toString in class SvgObject
